Wheeljack-X::

Jackie grabs one more piece of equipment before he heads to the main 
entrance.  As a precaution, he seals off the foyer, then sets up his 
accessory - a large electric fan.  Switching it on to full power 
causes quite a wind, and Jackie smiles behind his protective 
faceplate.  He's partly counting on that wind to keep him safe.

The Autobot opens the main doors just far enough for his sample drone 
to get through, and gives his windmaker one final adjustment to make 
sure it's blowing the right way.  Then he opens a three-foot hole in 
the shields and sends the plastic 'bot on its way.  "Taking sample 
now," he reports over the comm, raising his voice to compensate for 
the loud whirring of the fan.  "No problems thus far."

--- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, Richard Allen <roborick007@y...> wrote:
> 
> : : Kup : :
> Kup(via commlink): Hmm, that's a good idea. Just do it carefully. 
Wheeljack, permission granted.
>  cardhead649 <cardhead649@y...> wrote:A vaccine's not good enough 
for this Autobot.  The first thing he 
> does is construct a special sampling drone, one that would be 
> unaffected by the rust plague.  He stops for only half a second to 
> admire his handiwork before activating his comm.
> 
> "Kup, I'm requesting permission to send a plastic drone outside to 
> take a sample of that dust, so I can work on a cure to stamp this 
> plague out once and for all."
> 
> --- In nbwrpg@yahoogroups.com, "cardhead649" <cardhead649@y...> 
wrote:
> > Wheeljack-X::
> > 
> > The red alert sends Jackie scrambling for the labs.  "There has 
to 
> be 
> > a cure for this," he tells himself.  "And I'm gonna find it or 
die 
> > trying!"
>
